title: Asset Property Specification
description: Defines what properties are available in asset files.

anyOf.description: Any asset assignable to SDG.Unturned.VehicleAsset or SDG.Unturned.VehicleRedirectorAsset.
Any asset assignable to SDG.Unturned.DialogueAsset, SDG.Unturned.QuestAsset, or SDG.Unturned.VendorAsset.

EAssetType.description: An asset category used to sort different categories of short IDs.

VectorTypeOptions.description: The type of vector syntaxes to parse.

Inverted.description: Whether or not the result of this condition should be inverted.

Operation.description: The operator being used to compare.

anyOf.description: Less Than or Equal To (Case Insensitive)
Greater Than or Equal To (Case Insensitive)

And.description: This value evalates to whether or not all the given conditions evaluate to true.

Or.description: This value evalates to whether or not at least one of the given conditions evaluate to true.

Case.description: This value evalates to the result of the given condition.

$udat-type.description: The type of object to create.

And.description: The conditions that must all evaluate to true to match this case.

Value.description: The value that is used when this case is matched.

Or.description: The conditions where at least one must evaluate to true to match this case.

Value.description: The value that is used when this case is matched.

Case.description: The condition that must be met to match this case.

Value.description: The value that is used when this case is matched.
The value that is used when this case is matched.

When.description: A condition that must be met to consider this branch of cases.

Cases.description: Switch value that will be branched into if the 'When' condition is met.

When.description: A condition that must be met to consider this branch of cases.

Value.description: The value that is used when this case is matched.

And.description: The conditions that must all evaluate to true to match this case.

Value.description: The value that is used when this case is matched.

Or.description: The conditions where at least one must evaluate to true to match this case.

Value.description: The value that is used when this case is matched.

Case.description: The condition that must be met to match this case.

Value.description: The value that is used when this case is matched.
The value that is used when this case is matched.

Type.title: Zero or more characters of UTF-16 text.

SupportsRichText.description: Whether or not rich text is allowed.

SupportsNewLines.description:
Whether or not the line break tag is allowed (
).

FormatArguments.description: Maximum number of formatting args that can be present in the string.

ExtraTag.description: An additional rich text tags that can be used.

ExtraTags.description: Additional rich text tags that can be used.

Type.title: A property using this type defines the key of a localization property by it's value.

MinimumLength.description: Minimum character count of the key (inclusive).

MaximumLength.description: Maximum character count of the key (inclusive).

MinimumValueLength.description: Minimum character count of the value (inclusive).

MaximumValueLength.description: Maximum character count of the value (inclusive).

ValueSupportsRichText.description: Whether or not rich text is allowed in the localization value.

ValueSupportsNewLines.description:
Whether or not the line break tag is allowed in the localization value (
).

ValueFormatArguments.description: Maximum number of formatting args that can be present in the localization value.

ValueExtraTag.description: An additional rich text tags that can be used in the localization value.

ValueExtraTags.description: Additional rich text tags that can be used in the localization value.

Type.title: A string that can either appear in the asset file or localization file.

SupportsRichText.description: Whether or not rich text is allowed.

SupportsNewLines.description:
Whether or not the line break tag is allowed (
).

RequiresValue.description: Whether or not the non-local property must have a value to not use the one in localization. Basically if TryGetValue is used instead of ContainsKey. Defaults to false.

PreferLocalizationValue.description: Whether or not the localization value will be used first if both exist. Defaults to false.

FormatArguments.description: Maximum number of formatting args that can be present.

ExtraTag.description: An additional rich text tags that can be used in the localization value.

ExtraTags.description: Additional rich text tags that can be used in the localization value.

LocalizationKeyOverride.description: Expression used to get the localization key instead of just using the same key as the given property.

ElementType.description: Type of elements in the list.

CountType.description: Type of integer used to parse the legacy count.

Mode.description: What kinds of lists to parse (bitwise flag).

LegacySingleKey.description: Key for the single property when "LegacySingle" is included. Defaults to the value of LegacySingularKey.

LegacySingularKey.description: Base key for elements in legacy lists. For example, 'Condition', for Conditions, Condition_0, etc.

SkipUnderscoreInLegacyKey.description: Indicates that the '_' should not be used to separate LegacySingularKey's value and the index. Defaults to false.

LegacyDefaultElementTypeValue.description: Default value for undefined legacy elements or elements without values.

RequireUniqueValues.description: Determines whether or not all elements in the list must be unique (or a warning is shown). Defaults to false.

ElementContext.description: Determines which type of property the actual elements of the list should be in. This only works for legacy list modes. Defaults to "Unspecified".

Type.title: A list of values separated by commas in a string value.

ElementType.description: Type of elements in the list.

SplitOptions.description: How to handle string values when splitting elements.

ValueType.description: Type of values in the dictionary.

KeyType.description: Type of key to parse. Also influences auto-complete. Defaults to "String".

RequireKeyType.description: Whether or not a key that isn't a valid value in "KeyType" should produce an error.

anyOf.title: A Globally Unique Identifier (also called a UUID) referencing another asset. Can be parsed as a string or object.
A Globally Unique Identifier (also called a UUID) referencing another asset. Can only be parsed as a string.
A backwards-compatible GUID or ID referencing another asset. Can be parsed as a string or object.
A backwards-compatible GUID or ID referencing another asset. Can only be parsed as a string.
An asset GUID or short ID, where ElementType is the category or asset type.
A short/legacy ID to an asset.
A short/legacy ID to an asset that can be left as a negative number to indicate the default value.

AssetType.description: Any references must have this type in their type hierarchy.

AssetTypes.description: Any references must have at least one of these types in their type hierarchy.

SupportsThis.description: Whether or not the word 'this' can be used to refer to the current asset.

PreventSelfReference.description: Whether or not referencing the current asset should produce a warning.

anyOf.title: A reference to a Unity object in the specified masterbundle. Exact same as MasterBundleReference.
A reference to an AudioClip or OneShotAudioDefinition in the specified masterbundle using the same syntax as a MasterBundleReference.
A reference to a Unity object in the specified masterbundle.
A reference to a Unity object in the specified masterbundle, with either the MasterBundleReference or the ContentReference format. MasterBundleReference is preferred.
A reference to a Unity object in the specified masterbundle, but the dictionary syntax isn't allowed.
No longer in the game, but used to be a reference to a localization token by namespace and token.

BaseType.description: Any objects being referenced must have this type in their type hierarchy.

BaseTypes.description: Any objects being referenced must have at least one of these types in their type hierarchy.

Kind.description: Special kind/unit describing the value of this vector.

XKey.description: Overrides the "X" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

YKey.description: Overrides the "Y" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

LegacyXKey.description: Overrides the "X" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "XKey".

LegacyYKey.description: Overrides the "Y" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "YKey".

SkipLegacyCombineWithUnderscore.description: If true, the '_' placed between the base key and the defined legacy key will be excluded.

Type.title: A Vector3 (X, Y, Z) or object.

Kind.description: Special kind/unit describing the value of this vector.

XKey.description: Overrides the "X" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

YKey.description: Overrides the "Y" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

ZKey.description: Overrides the "Z" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

LegacyXKey.description: Overrides the "X" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "XKey".

LegacyYKey.description: Overrides the "Y" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "YKey".

LegacyZKey.description: Overrides the "Z" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "ZKey".

SkipLegacyCombineWithUnderscore.description: If true, the '_' placed between the base key and the defined legacy key will be excluded.

Type.title: A Vector4 (X, Y, Z, W) or object.

Kind.description: Special kind/unit describing the value of this vector.

XKey.description: Overrides the "X" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

YKey.description: Overrides the "Y" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

ZKey.description: Overrides the "Z" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

WKey.description: Overrides the "W" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

LegacyXKey.description: Overrides the "X" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "XKey".

LegacyYKey.description: Overrides the "Y" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "YKey".

LegacyZKey.description: Overrides the "Z" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "ZKey".

LegacyWKey.description: Overrides the "W" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "WKey".

SkipLegacyCombineWithUnderscore.description: If true, the '_' placed between the base key and the defined legacy key will be excluded.

Type.title: A color with components from 0 to 1.

Alpha.description: If true, the alpha channel will also be parsed.

StrictHex.description: If true, string values must be exactly 7 or 9 characters, depending on the value of "Alpha".

ModernIs32Bit.description: Whether or not the modern (object) color should be parsed using 32-bit (0-255) rules.

RKey.description: Overrides the "R" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

GKey.description: Overrides the "G" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

BKey.description: Overrides the "B" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

AKey.description: Overrides the "A" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

LegacyRKey.description: Overrides the "R" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "RKey".

LegacyGKey.description: Overrides the "G" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "GKey".

LegacyBKey.description: Overrides the "B" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "BKey".

LegacyAKey.description: Overrides the "A" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "AKey".

SkipLegacyCombineWithUnderscore.description: If true, the '_' placed between the base key and the defined legacy key will be excluded.

Type.title: A color with components from 0 to 255.

Alpha.description: If true, the alpha channel will also be parsed.

StrictHex.description: If true, string values must be exactly 7 or 9 characters, depending on the value of "Alpha".

RKey.description: Overrides the "R" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

GKey.description: Overrides the "G" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

BKey.description: Overrides the "B" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

AKey.description: Overrides the "A" property name for modern (and maybe legacy) parsing.

LegacyRKey.description: Overrides the "R" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "RKey".

LegacyGKey.description: Overrides the "G" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "GKey".

LegacyBKey.description: Overrides the "B" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "BKey".

LegacyAKey.description: Overrides the "A" property name for legacy parsing. Defaults to "AKey".

SkipLegacyCombineWithUnderscore.description: If true, the '_' placed between the base key and the defined legacy key will be excluded.

Type.title: A reference to a CLR (C#) type in an assembly-qualified name format (defaulting to Assembly-CSharp).

BaseType.description: Any references must have this type in their type hierarchy.

BaseTypes.description: Any references must have at least one of these types in their type hierarchy.

Mode.description: The type of TypeReference to parse.

EnumType.description: An optional fully-qualified enum type that can also be used to reference types by an enum value.

Type.title: The level of a skill or blueprint skill.

Skill.description: Property reference to a skill name property. Should not be set with "SpecialityIndex" and "SkillIndex". Assumes a property-ref.

AllowNegatives.description: Whether or not negative values can be used to imply no skill.

Type.title: The level of a skill or blueprint skill.

SpecialityIndex.description: Property reference to a speciality index property. Also requires that "SkillIndex" is set. Assumes a property-ref.

SkillIndex.description: Property reference to a skill index property. Also requires that "SpecialityIndex" is set. Assumes a property-ref.

AllowNegatives.description: Whether or not negative values can be used to imply no skill.

anyOf.title: A flag which does not have a value.
An integer from 0 to 255 inclusive.
An integer from 0 to 65535 inclusive.
An integer from 0 to 4294967295 inclusive.
An integer from 0 to 18446744073709551615 inclusive.
An integer from -128 to 127 inclusive.
An integer from -32768 to 32767 inclusive.
An integer from -2147483648 to 2147483647 inclusive.
Zero or more characters of UTF-16 text.
A regular expression.
Single-precision floating point decimal.
Double-precision floating point decimal.
Quadruple-precision floating point decimal.
True or false value.
A flag unless the value is 'false', which overrides the flag being included.
A single UTF-16 character.
A type that exists in the base game, or an enum value, which is defined in ElementType.
A Globally Unique Identifier (also called a UUID). This is not an asset reference, just a value.
A Globally Unique Identifier (also called a UUID) or UInt16. This is not an asset reference, just a value.
The assembly-qualified name of a CLR type. To specify expected base types, use "TypeReferenceType" instead.
A color with components from 0 to 255.
A color with components from 0 to 1.
An index of a built-in face texture.
An index of a built-in beard texture.
An index of a built-in hair texture.
An 8-bit unsigned integer referencing a navigation graph in a map.
A string ID referencing a spawnpoint node in a map.
A string ID referencing a NPC overlap volume in a map.
The index of a zombie table defined in the editor.
The unique name of a cooldown tracking instance.
A flag short ID.
The ID of an achievement that can be given by NPCs.
A UTC date and time.
A time or time span.
A UTC date and time (parsed as a DateTimeOffset).
A Vector4 (X, Y, Z, W) or object.
A Vector3 (X, Y, Z) or object.
A Vector2 (X, Y) or object.
A reference to a Unity object in the specified masterbundle. Exact same as MasterBundleReference.
A reference to an AudioClip or OneShotAudioDefinition in the specified masterbundle using the same syntax as a MasterBundleReference.
A reference to a Unity object in the specified masterbundle.
A reference to a Unity object in the specified masterbundle, with either the MasterBundleReference or the ContentReference format. MasterBundleReference is preferred.
A reference to a Unity object in the specified masterbundle, but the dictionary syntax isn't allowed.
No longer in the game, but used to be a reference to a localization token by namespace and token.
The name of a .masterbundle file.
The name of a .unity3d file.
The version of an asset bundle or master bundle.
The name/ID of a map.
A key ending in _Button and _Button_Tooltip in PlayerDashboardInventory.dat.
A string that can either appear in the asset file or localization file.
A property using this type defines the key of a localization property by it's value.
The name of a skill.
The name of a blueprint skill.
The level of a skill or blueprint skill.
A 32 bit integer representing a SteamItemDef_t value (Steam inventory item ID).
An arbitrary ID that has to be shared between an attachment and weapon for them to be compatible.
An arbitrary ID that has to be shared between a tool and damagable actor for them to be compatible.
A physics material name.
A physics material name or legacy SDG.Unturned.EPhysicsMaterial.
A CSteamID in decimal format. Element type can define a numeric EAccountType to check.
A URL with content type optionally supplied.
A path to a Unity component or GameObject.
A property that can have any kind of value. Not validated at all.

TemplateGroup.description: Unique name of this group (amongst the this asset type's hierarchy).

Name.description: Unique name of this group (amongst the this asset type's hierarchy).

UseValueOf.description: The name of a property with $n formatted for each template group (like $1 for group 1's value).

Group.description: The one-based index of this group. Defaults to it's position in the 'TemplateGroups' array.

Alias.description: Another key that can be used for this property.
Another key that can be used for this property.

LegacyExpansionFilter.description: Specifies whether this alias can be used with only the legacy format or only the modern format. Don't include this property if it can be used with both.

Condition.description: A condition that must be met to use this alias.

ExclusionCondition.description: A property that shouldn't exist with this property.

Key.description: A property that shouldn't exist with this property.

Value.description: The value that Key can't be equal to. If this property is excluded, it matches any value.

Condition.description: Optional condition when this should be applied.

ExclusionConditions.description: List of properties with values that should not co-exist with this property.

InclusionCondition.description: A property that must co-exist with this property.

Key.description: A property that must co-exist with this property.

Value.description: The value that Key must be equal to. If this property is excluded, it matches any value.

Condition.description: Optional condition when this should be applied. If the 'Variable' property of this condition is the same property as 'Key' references and 'RequirementCondition' is excluded, this acts as a requirement for property 'Key' unless otherwise specified.

RequirementCondition.description: A requirement that must be met related to the condition.

ConditionIsRequirement.description: Whether or not 'Condition' is a requirement for the property defined by 'Key', instead of a condition on whether or not the inclusion condition should be applied.

InclusionConditions.description: List of properties that should exist if this exists. Also defines conditions that must be met.

RequireOverride.description: Behaves similar to Java's @Override when true, throwing an error if there is no parent property with the same key.

PreventOverride.description: Behaves similar to C#'s new keyword when true, ensuring that the property is treated as a separate property from it's base property.

KeyLegacyExpansionFilter.description: Specifies whether the key can be used with only the legacy format or only the modern format. Don't include this property if it can be used with both.

KeyCondition.description: A condition that must be met to use the key.

SingleKeyOverride.description: If 'Template', the singular version of the key which would not be a template (ex. Blade for Blade_#).

FileCrossRef.description: Designates a property that selects the cross-ref file for any properties starting with "$cr$::".

ListReference.description: Reference to a set of values from a list. Example: 'Blueprints.Id'. If it ends with '!' it's an error to not reference a valid value.

Aliases.description: Other keys that can be used for this property.

Alias.description: Another key that can be used for this property.

SubtypeSwitch.description: Indicates that the value of this property should change this object's type based on this property in the enum. The type should be a subtype of the current type.

anyOf.description: Property must appear in the 'Asset' section. If there isn't an 'Asset' section, it must be at the root level.
If the 'Metadata' section is present, this property can only be read from it. If not it must be at the root level.
If the 'Metadata' section is present, this property can only be read from it. If not it must be in the 'Asset' section if it exists, otherwise at the root level.

Prioritizes reading the property from the 'Metadata' section, but if it's not present it will be read from the 'Asset' section instead. If the 'Asset' section is also not present it'll be read at the root level.
The property can only exist at the root level, even if an 'Asset' section is present.
The property can only exist in the 'Metadata' section.
The property can only exist in the 'Asset' section.

AssetPosition.description: The expected location of this property when it's in an asset.

DefaultValue.description: The default value for this property if applicable. If 'IncludedDefaultValue' is used, this indicates the default value if the property is not included.

IncludedDefaultValue.description: The default value for this property if applicable. Indicates the default value if the property is included but not parsed correctly.

Markdown.description: Longer markdown description of the property.

Variable.description: Name of the variable in the C# class.

Version.description: Unturned version when this option was added.

Docs.description: Link to the Unturned modding docs when a page is available.

Minimum.description: Inclusive minimum value of the property.

Maximum.description: Inclusive maximum value of the property.

MinimumExclusive.description: Exclusive minimum value of the property.

MaximumExclusive.description: Exclusive maximum value of the property.

MinimumCount.description: Inclusive minimum for this property's list element count or string character count.

MaximumCount.description: Inclusive maximum for this property's list element count or string character count.

Except.description: Exceptions to the minimum/maximum range if specified, otherwise a value blacklist.

Deprecated.description: If this property shouldn't be used anymore or was left in for legacy features.

Experimental.description: If this property is experimental and may change in the future.

Key.description: The key of the flag or property in a parent type.

HideInherited.description: If this property should be removed from this type when inherited from a parent.

Version.description: Unturned version when this file type was added.

Docs.description: Link to the Unturned modding docs when a page is available.

Parent.description: Assembly-qualified name of the parent type, or null for types without relevant parents.

AutoGeneratedKeys.description: Whether or not all property keys have the exact same name as their field/property name in code unless otherwise defined.

OverridableProperties.description: Whether or not properties without values are parsed as their default value and don't raise an error.

StringParseableType.description: Pre-defined fully-qualified C# type name used to parse values of this type (a ITypeConverter<T>).

Properties.description: List of all properties that can be defined.

Localization.description: List of all properties that can be defined.

Version.description: Unturned version when this file type was added.

IsFlags.description: If this enum is a [Flags] enum and should be parsed by comma-separated values.

UnderlyingType.description: The underlying type of the enum.

Docs.description: Link to the Unturned modding docs when a page is available.

StringParseableType.description: Pre-defined fully-qualified C# type name used to parse values of this type (a ITypeConverter<T>).

Value.description: The name of the enum field.

Casing.description: The proper-case version of 'Value'. Must be exactly equal to 'Value' besides casing.

CorrespondingType.description: Matches this enum to a CLR type for a TypeOrEnum property.

RequiredBaseType.description: The required type of this asset to use this value (also matches subtypes).

Description.description: Description of the enum field's behavior.

Deprecated.description: If this field is deprecated/obsolete and shouldn't be used.

Docs.description: Link to the Unturned modding docs when a page is available.

NumericValue.description: The value of the enum in binary. Used with flag enums.

Skill.description: Additional property for the EBlueprintSkill enum mapping to the corresponding skill.

InteractableType.description: Additional property for the EBuild enum mapping to the Interactable type used by the game.

Color.description: Defines a corresponding color for an enum value.

Abbreviation.description: Indicates an operator or abbreviation this enum corresponds to.

RedirectableAssetKey.description: The key of the redirect property for this asset.

SingleKeyOverride.description: If 'Template', the singular version of the key which would not be template.

Template.description: If 'Key' is a template expression to match properties with indices.

TemplateGroupUniqueValue.description: If every value in this template group should be unique. Ignored if 'Template' is not true.

TemplateGroups.description: If 'Template', then this is a list of groups by name to match with other properties within the given template group.

ValueTemplateGroupReference.description: A data-ref to another key's template group (such as ($cr$::SDG.Unturned.ItemAsset, Assembly-CSharp::Blueprints).TemplateGroups[0] ) to reference the blueprint ID of another item. Valid values will be the present indices in the other property's template groups.

AnimationComponentFindArgument.description: The child GameObject that should have the Animation component attached.

Name.description: The name of the animation in Unity.

NameProperty.description: The name of a property that represents the actual name of this animation if it's present.

SingleNameOverride.description: If 'Template', the singular version of the name which would not be a template.

Template.description: If 'Name' is a template expression to match properties.

TemplateGroups.description: If 'Template', then this is a list of groups by name to match with other properties within the given template group.

Type.description: Assembly-qualified name of the asset type.

Parent.description: Assembly-qualified name of the parent type, or null for types without relevant parents.

Category.description: Category of the asset, if any.

VanillaIdLimit.description: The first ID that isn't reserved by vanilla. 0 if this doesn't apply.

RequireId.description: If this type requires a non-zero unique ID.

DisplayName.description: Display name of the type of asset.

Docs.description: Link to the Unturned modding docs when a page is available.

Version.description: Unturned version when this file type was added.

AutoGeneratedKeys.description: Whether or not all property keys have the exact same name as their field/property name in code unless otherwise defined.

OverridableProperties.description: Whether or not properties without values are parsed as their default value and don't raise an error.

Properties.description: List of all properties that can be defined.

Localization.description: List of all properties that can be defined.

BundleAssets.description: List of all assets loaded from Unity bundles with an expected name.
